intro: Mapouria miradorensis, commonly known as the Mirador beauty, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
